ratings.comment: Armbrecht thinks he's real cool but I found him to be more arrogant and self-righteous. definitely more interested in hearing himself talk than students learning. Frequently unprepared for class, either with the wrong course's material or without a clear plan.. lectures jump around A LOT, and he speaks english all the time. Wouldn't recommend.

He was teaching basically the same material to graduate students, and it showed that he didn't regard our class as anything important. He took forever to return papers, he was disorganized, and didn't have any consistency during lectures. There was no direction and you never knew what he expected on papers.
The class is pretty interesting and he gets you to think differently. But, he is disorganized and expects too much out of you.
Really hard to get a solid A. Very interactive, focuses on improvement. Lots of reading.

He's a good teacher, but he speaks very fast; faster than any french people I've met.  It takes some getting used to at first. It's an overall good class with a lot of variety, but we covered a lot of the same stuff I learned in high school.

There was a LOT to cover in this class, but he made the material interesting and definitely wanted to help all of the students succeed.  Really likes to teach and it shows!  He's a little bit quirky at times, but it's definitely worth taking a class with him.

very bright guy but it's hard to argue against his opinions. you must do all the readings and don't fall behind. the books we read were very ineteresting and unlike anything i had ever read before. contribute to class discussions and he will like you more. overall a good lit class
Armbrecht is amazing!  Tehre was WAY too much stuff to do in this class, but he still made it fun.  Images sucks.  The prof's French is really good!
The class got a lot better after he ditched the stupid Generation book.  Prof really konws a lot about contemporary French culture.  Really good accent--you'd almost think he's French!

Armbrecht is really good a teaching grammar, even in a class as big and as STUPID as ours!  (I can't believe some of the people in our class.)  311 is kind of a strange course (I can't believe we're doing this much grammar at the 300 level!), but I got a lot out of it.

first year teaching 311, and i doubt he will get better at it. he was unorganized, chose poor class materials, often confused due dates and entire assignments. brings nothing refreshing or original to classes, expects tons of busy work. also very self-centered. attendance is WAY too important to him. nice guy in theory though.

It was a very interesting class with readings that didn't appear to be interesting at first, but after discussing them in class took on a whole new meaning.  Three papers and a project for the semester, but he is very picky and strict on the papers.  It's a good class if you really want to dive into lit analysis.  Very nice guy!
Class is very boring. After this french I'm thinking if I want to take any other french classes. Very hard to get an A. Reading are boring and discussions are hard to participate in.
He's not so hard--you just have do the work!  I'd totally recommend that students take the French play.  It's the best French class I've ever taken!!!
Professor Armbrecht isn't the easiest professor around, but he knows his sh*t!  Don't be intimidated by him...he's actually really nice.  Cool shoes too!

Armbrecht is brilliant, which has its good and bad points.  Good: interesting classes, amazing discussions, makes you think.  Bad: demanding, expects a lot out of students.  He's very organized and wants you to be too.
